flawed_nl_solution:
If yesterday the number of buyers was half the number of buyers the day before, then yesterday there were 1/2*50 = <<1/2*50=25>>25 buyers.
Today has 40 more buyers than yesterday, so there were 40+25 = <<40+25=56>>56 buyers today.
The total number of buyers in the store for the three days will be 56+25+50 = <<56+25+50=131>>131 buyers

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 65, not 56. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
